last_episode_to_air.name: Billy Connolly
last_episode_to_air.overview: In a one-off special of the acclaimed psychologically-based interview show, Shrink Rap , Dr Pamela Connolly puts her husband on the couch.

name: Shrink Rap
overview: Actress and writer Pamela Stephenson is now a successful therapist – Dr Pamela Connolly – with a private practice in Los Angeles. She draws upon her professional training when interviewing A-list celebrities.

seasons.name: Series 1
seasons.overview: The first full series of Dr Pamela Connolly's unconventional talk show, where she tries to find out what lies beneath the surface of some of the world's most fascinating and successful people. Guests include Stephen Fry, Sharon Osbourne, and The Duchess of York. This series also features the pilot show in which she talks to comedian and actor Robin Williams.

seasons.name: Series 2
seasons.overview: The second series of Dr Pamela Connolly's unconventional talk show analysing celebrities, guests include Joan Rivers, Tony Curtis and Gene Simmons. The series also features an interview with actor and comedian Chris Langham soon after his release from jail, where he served a sentence for possessing child pornography.

episodes.name: Sharon Osbourne
episodes.overview: Sharon Osbourne is one of the best-known women in Britain. But her childhood was chaotic. Her father - pop manager Don Arden - was a disciplinarian who would lock her in the coalhole for punishment.

episodes.name: Stephen Fry
episodes.overview: Dr Pamela Connolly talks to Stephen Fry. She sets out to explore how fame has affected his psyche and why his celebrated mind has at times been in such torment that he has even tried to kill himself.

episodes.name: David Blunkett
episodes.overview: David Blunkett talks movingly to Dr Pamela Connolly about his 'worst hour' - when his adored father was fatally scalded in an accident - and about his public split from Kimberly Quinn

episodes.name: Sarah, Duchess of York
episodes.overview: Dr Pamela Connolly talks to Sarah, Duchess of York about her problems with weight and self-image, and her difficult childhood

episodes.name: Robin Williams
episodes.overview: In this pilot show, Dr Pamela Connolly talks to comedian and Oscar-winning actor Robin Williams about his unusual childhood, his problems with substance abuse and his first sexual experiences.

1.name: Series 1
1.overview: The first full series of Dr Pamela Connolly's unconventional talk show, where she tries to find out what lies beneath the surface of some of the world's most fascinating and successful people. Guests include Stephen Fry, Sharon Osbourne, and The Duchess of York. This series also features the pilot show in which she talks to comedian and actor Robin Williams.

episodes.name: Chris Langham
episodes.overview: Dr Pamela Connolly talks to comedian and writer Chris Langham on his release from jail. He talks openly about the abuse he endured as a child, his addictions, his trial and imprisonment.

episodes.name: Joan Rivers
episodes.overview: Dr Pamela Connolly talks to comedian Joan Rivers to find out what makes her so funny, why she hates her body, what she is like when the jokes stop and what sex is like in your 70s.

episodes.name: Gene Simmons
episodes.overview: Dr Pamela Connolly talks to Gene Simmons, outrageous front man of heavy metal band Kiss and one of America's most successful rock stars. Pamela looks beneath the exterior of this quintessential Alpha male to find out what lies behind his relentless need for success and self-gratification.

episodes.name: Tony Curtis
episodes.overview: Dr Pamela Connolly talks to Tony Curtis about his violent mother, his guilt over the death of his younger brother and his relationships with some of the most famous women in the world.

episodes.name: Salman Rushdie
episodes.overview: Dr Pamela Connolly talks to Booker Prize winning author Sir Salman Rushdie, famed as much for his writing as for his four marriages and the Iranian fatwa that forced him into hiding for a decade.

episodes.name: Kathleen Turner
episodes.overview: Dr Pamela Connolly talks to actress Kathleen Turner. Diagnosed with rheumatoid arthritis, she took to drink to ease the pain. She talks about the illness and how she coped with drinking.

2.name: Series 2
2.overview: The second series of Dr Pamela Connolly's unconventional talk show analysing celebrities, guests include Joan Rivers, Tony Curtis and Gene Simmons. The series also features an interview with actor and comedian Chris Langham soon after his release from jail, where he served a sentence for possessing child pornography.

episodes.name: Billy Connolly
episodes.overview: In a one-off special of the acclaimed psychologically-based interview show, Shrink Rap , Dr Pamela Connolly puts her husband on the couch.

episodes.name: Heather Mills
episodes.overview: Dr Pamela Connolly talks to Heather Mills about the former model's childhood, the tragic accident in which she lost part of her left leg and her divorce from Paul McCartney, which put her in the middle of a media storm.

episodes.name: Carrie Fisher
episodes.overview: Dr Pamela Connolly talks to Carie Fisher. The daughter of Hollywood royalty - actress Debbie Reynolds and singer Eddie Fisher - Fisher became famous as Princess Leia in Star Wars. But at 24, after drink and drugs problems, she was diagnosed with bipolar disorder.
